intro: Allanblackia sacleuxii, commonly known as the African shea tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to west and central Africa. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain a valuable oil-rich seed, which is used in cosmetics and food products. Allanblackia sacleuxii thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ecological importance includes supporting local wildlife and contributing to soil stability in its native habitat.
